Title.En: VESACCO: Smart e-bikes for health and green travel

Description.En:
The student time in this challenge will be approximately 45 hours, with 30 hours of "classes" (onsite or online) with knowledge transfer, practical work and team work.   

The challenge includes 2 synchronous online sessions in the beginning and one session at the end of the challenge when the results are presented to the challenge provider. For the students choosing the option of the mobility week (week 4), there will of course be a number of synchronous and on-site activities, like visiting INSA and the labs, the university hospital and the challenger providers offices in Toulouse.   

The challenge will be carried out in small, intercultural and interdisciplinary teams. They will have to work together, but can agree on their time schedule and will work asynchronously during the challenge.  

Assessment will be divided in formative assessments during the challenge with small tasks to be done and a sommative assessment at the end of the challenge in the form of the prototype of the connected smart e-bike of the group and a presentation in English in front of a panel.

Title.En: Analyze and test medical devices, and compare existing e-bike solutions

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of this challenge, students will be able to test and evaluate the effectiveness of medical devices, as well as compare the impact that existing smart e-bike solutions have on health and well-being.

Title.En: Prototype and test innovative travel solutions combined with physiotherapy

PrefLabel.En: use e-health and mobile health technologies

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of this challenge, students will be able to design, prototype, and test innovative green travel solutions combined with physiotherapy treatment.

Title.En: Test smart e-bikes and work on the "sport on prescription" concept.

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of this challenge, students will be able to test smart e-bikes on volunteers concerning the cardiac and respiratory functions and work on the "sport on prescription" concept.

Title.En: Work in an interdisciplinary and international team

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of this challenge, students will be able to integrate an interdisciplinary and international team and present the methodology used and the main results in English.

Title.En: VESACCO: Smart e-bikes for health and green travel
VESACCO: Smart e-bikes for health and green travel

LegalName.En: INSTITUT NATIONAL DES SCIENCES APPLIQUEES DE TOULOUSE (INSA TOULOUSE)

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
The student time in this challenge will be approximately 45 hours, with 30 hours of "classes" (onsite or online) with knowledge transfer, practical work and team work.

The challenge includes 2 synchronous online sessions in the beginning and one session at the end of the challenge when the results are presented to the challenge provider.

For the students choosing the option of the mobility week (week 4), there will of course be a number of synchronous and on site activities, like visiting INSA and the labs, the university hospital and the challenger providers offices n Toulouse.

The challenge will be carried out in small, intercultural and interdisciplinary teams.

They will have to work together, but can agree on their time schedule and will work asynchronously during the challenge.

Assessment will be divided in formative assessments during the challenge with small tasks to be done and a sommative assessment at the end of the challenge in the form of the prototype of the connected smart e-bike of the group and a presentation in English in front of a jury.

This challenge is 2 ECTS and 1 ECTS for the mobility week (week 4).

**The challenge includes the Teaching and learning activities:**

- Intercultural workshops to deconstruct biases and be able to work in international groups.
- An optional short mobility in week 4 in Toulouse will allow to meet partners and accelerate team building.
- State of the art on soft mobility and environmental impact in daily transport
- State of the art on intermediate vehicles and their state of progress.
- Analysis of ‘climatic’ needs and current uses
- Study of the current technological solutions and its limitations on a matrix of uses.
- Comparative analysis with the new INSA ‘Maillon Mobility’ platform
- Implementation of a ‘patient pathway’, with cardiorespiratory function tests on volunteer subjects, followed by prescription of physical activity.
- Equipping and testing the impact of physical activity with connected health devices
- Brainstorming and design of the ‘VESACCO of the future’ range (CAD, system integration).
- Prototyping and testing as the project progress.

Everybody has heard about green mobility, but replacing physiotherapy by biking? Our idea is to combine green mobility with smart e-bike and health sensors allowing to do exercises prescribed by a doctor.
This could be an energy and cost efficient solution to excessive sedentary, one of the worst chronic diseases for humans. Because we are the only living species able to use "transports", we spend lot of time in seated position even when we travel over longer distances.

Smart E-bikes with some basic monitoring have already been tested and are available at the LAAS-CNRS, one of the INSA Toulouse labs, but we'd like to go further in this challenge and design the "smart e-bike for your health" of the future. Come and join us for this adventure. We will combine work on green mobility with the smart e-bike design, do market studies and prototype the new bike.
During an (optional) mobility week in week 4, you can meet the partners of your international team and visit labs and the university hospital and meet the challenge provider.

We will accept students with any background, they should nevertheless have an interest in technology and health.

We'd appreciate students with fields of study related to mechatronics, mechanics or electronics who will be able to share their competencies with the other students of the group and help the project to go further.

Students should be at least at L3 level (third year of bachelor) and submit a CV, transcript of records, and a cover letter for explain their interest. The challenge will start at the beginning of February 2025, so please apply by 24th of January 2025 at the latest.

Regarding financial support for your mobility, please consult your home university. You can contact them directly via the contact form [https://engage.eciu.eu/contact](https://engage.eciu.eu/contact)  .
